body: As the topic says, I am sick with the stomach flu and its been 2 weeks, I am just wondering how long this usually lasts without throwing up every 10 mins.
body_tagged: As the topic says, I am sick with the stomach flu and its been 2 weeks, I am just wondering how long this usually lasts without throwing up every 10 mins.
title: Longest you have ever been sick?

replies.body: about a month, I had walking pneumonia and then right after that I got my appendix taken out.
replies.body_tagged: about a month, I had walking pneumonia and then right after that I got my appendix taken out.

replies.body:
No idea.

but one time, me, my 2 brothers, sisters and parents all got sick. For like, 3 weeks. All  we could hear was coughing.
replies.body_tagged:
No idea.

but one time, me, my 2 brothers, sisters and parents all got sick. For like, 3 weeks. All  we could hear was coughing.

replies.body:
2 months. Started with the flu, then turned into pneumonia/delirium, then back to the flu. It wasn't fun. =/

EDIT: I lied, it started with the 'Common Cold', then turned into the flu. Once I got the flu a second time, it started to calm down and go into the Cold again, but the Cold symptoms only lasted about 4-5 days. It was close to 2 months and 1 week.

replies.body:
4 months.

A never ending cycle of pneumonia, scarlet fever, and salmonella poisoning. (Salmonella started it.) Also some mosquito disease I forgot the name of.

To top it off, some meningococcal.

replies.body: About 3 days, I don't get sick often.

replies.body:
Yeah its ross river
Ross River virus (RRV) is a small encapsulated single-strand RNA alphavirusendemic to Australia, Papua New Guinea and other islands in the South Pacific. It is responsible for a type of mosquito-borne non-lethal but debilitating tropical diseaseknown as Ross River fever, previously termed "epidemic polyarthritis". The virus is suspected to be enzootic in populations of various native Australian mammals, and has been found on occasion in horses.[1]rRoss River virus (RRV) is a small encapsulated single-strand RNA alphavirusendemic to Australia, Papua New Guinea and other islands in the South Pacific. It is responsible for a type of mosquito-borne non-lethal but debilitating tropical diseaseknown as Ross River fever, previously termed "epidemic polyarthritis". The virus is suspected to be enzootic in populations of various native Australian mammals, and has been found on occasion in horses.[1]

replies.body:
2 months, gastro. Also, fun fact:

Millaria is the #1 biggest cause of death known to human kind, it has killed the most people, mostly in Africa. Humans are the second main cause of death :P.

replies.body:
1 week 2 days
I don't get sick easily, but when I do I get hit hard.

Ex. I got a day a sickness that gave me a hesdache, was puking and my stomach hurt a lot, next day I started coughing for a week, last day I started puking again. Was the most painful on the last day.

Fun fact: that ended 2 days ago ^

replies.body:
About a week and a half. I don't get sick very often but this was at a time where there was a flu going round the whole school.

I got hit about a week after it was over, but on one day where loads of people were sick only 1/10th of the entire school was in...

replies.body: I've been sick 8-9 months when I was 4, I had heart surgery because I had a hole in it when I was born.. The medicine they gave me made me sick for a very long time ,_,
